Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a reclining naked child, Harpocrates holding a cornucopia. Seated naked figurine, chin resting on right hand with finger over mouth, left hand holding cornucopia. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating on head. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
"Fouilles de Naukratis (1895)" in Louvre register. Eg3333 from musée Guimet; no. 921 written in pen on underside Galliano, Genviève (dir.). Published by Dunand as Roman (Dunand 1990, 74-5, no.142).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.022) (Phase 3)
